revised_title: Quantization Conditions for Diatomic Dipole Molecule Rotation in a Homogeneous Electric Field
tldr: The authors present a new method for calculating the energy levels of a rigid diatomic dipole molecule in a homogeneous electric field using the phase-integral method. This method provides accurate results for all values of the electric field strength, improving upon previous perturbation theory calculations. The phase-integral method involves a general approximation of arbitrary order generated from an unspecified base function, which is chosen in two different ways to suit different scenarios.
